FuncDef: The reset vxlan statistics command clears VXLAN packet statistics. The reset vxlan statistics command clears VXLAN packet statistics. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: reset vxlan statistics source <source-ip> peer <peer-ip> vni <vni-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Clears VXLAN packet statistics collected based on the IP address of the peer virtualized edge node.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Clears VXLAN packets statistics collected based on a specified VNI ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

Specifies the value of VNI ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

Clears VXLAN packets statistics collected based on the source IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset vxlan statistics source 1.1.1.1 peer 1.1.1.2 vni 1
ExtraInfo: In cloud VPN scenarios, cloud GWs support VXLAN packet statistics collection. To clear VXLAN packet statistics, run the reset vxlan statistics command.
